message_1: A store sells two types of computer mice: one for $10 and another for $15. A customer wants to buy three mice, but can only spend up to $40. What combination of mice should the customer buy to maximize the number of mice without spending more than $40?
message_2: To maximize the number of mice without spending more than $40, the customer should buy two $10 mice and one $15 mouse. This will give them a total of three mice for a cost of $10 + $10 + $15 = $35, which is within their budget.
